note:
Director of the Bellfoundry Museum in Loughborough, UK. Passionate about industrial architecture, working-class history, community engagement and inclusive museums. Recovering academic publishing occasionally on James Joyce and Catholic Church history. Part-time tennis geek. Originally from Oldham, now a proud Beestonian.

Hobbies include non-strenuous walking, podcasts, and nosying around churches and churchyards. Here for the cats.
